metadata.name: System Information Discovery Using Ioreg
metadata.comment: Detects the use of "ioreg" which will show I/O Kit registry information. This process is used for system information discovery. It has been observed in-the-wild by calling this process directly or using bash and grep to look for specific strings.

batch.sql: SELECT * FROM process_activity WHERE time BETWEEN CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() - INTERVAL 24 HOUR AND CURRENT_TIMESTAMP() AND (activity_id = 1 AND endswith(lower(process.name), lower('/ioreg')) AND contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ioreg')) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-l')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('-c'))) AND (contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('appleahcidiskdriver')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('ioplatformexpertdevice')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('oracle')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('parallels')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('usb vendor name')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('virtualbox')) OR contains(lower(process.cmd_line), lower('vmware'))))

output.summary: Detects the use of "ioreg" which will show I/O Kit registry information. This process is used for system information discovery. It has been observed in-the-wild by calling this process directly or using bash and grep to look for specific strings.
